info.title: API Banking - Payments
info.description:
**API Banking - Payments**

 Facilitates domestic and cross border transactions. Move Money APIs help to facilitate your finance operations such as cross border payment initiation, instant domestic payments, retrieval of payments details and statuses.

tags.name: Payment Initiation
tags.description: Facilitates domestic or cross border transactions. Move Money APIs help to facilitate your finance operations such as domestic or cross border payment initiation

tags.name: Proxy
tags.description:
Facilitates instant domestic transactions using proxies. A proxy allows you to instruct payments by identifying beneficiaries using secondary identifier such as mobile number, NRIC, Business Registration Number, etc.
Move Money APIs help to facilitate your finance operations such as instant domestic payments.

tags.name: Inquiry
tags.description: Inquiry APIs enables you to retrieve payment details and statuses for both domestic and cross border transactions

post.description:
The FAST Initiation API exposes the ability to initiate an Instant account to account payment instruction across Singapore, upon successful submission it returns a payment reference identifier. The Payment currency supported - SGD.

The response is a representation or acknowledgment that an instruction was received successfully. To check the status of a specific payment, you are required to use the Payment Status Inquiry API which provides the current state of the payment.

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

503.description: System dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

post.description:
The FAST Initiation API exposes the ability to initiate an Instant account to account payment instruction across Hong Kong, upon successful submission it returns a payment reference identifier. The Payment currency will remain as HKD.

The response is a representation or acknowledgment that an instruction was received successfully. To check the status of a specific payment, you are required to use the Payment Status Inquiry API which provides the current state of the payment.

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

503.description: System dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

post.description:
The Faster Payment Systems (FPS) Proxy Payment Initiation API exposes the ability to initiate a payment instruction, upon successful submission it returns a payment reference identifier.

The response is a representation or acknowledgment that an instruction was received successfully. To check the status of a specific payment, you are required to use the Payment Status Inquiry API which provides the current state of the payment.

The FPS mandates the population of the proxy identifier. The proxy identifier is the Hong Kong handle for a beneficiary.

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

503.description: System dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

post.summary: Hong Kong - FPS Proxy with Name Validation
post.description:
Initiate a Payment Instruction across Instant payments to a Proxy ID or Address post a Successful validation of the Payee Name against the Actual Name of the Payee with the creditor bank. To check the status of a specific payment, you are required to use the Payment Status Inquiry API which provides the current state of the payment.

The FPS Proxy mandates the population of the proxy identifier. The proxy identifier is the Hong Kong handle for a beneficiary.

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

503.description: System dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

post.description: The Payment Initiation IMPS API exposes the ability to initiate an instant fund transfer in India. Upon success it returns a payment reference identifier. The response is a representation or acknowledgment that an instruction was received successfully. To check the status of a specific payment, you are required to use the Payment Status Inquiry API which provides the current state of the payment.

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

503.description: System dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

post.description: The IMPS Proxy Payment Initiation API exposes the ability to initiate a payment instruction, upon successful submission it returns a payment reference identifier. The Payment currency supported - INR. The response is a representation or acknowledgment that an instruction was received successfully. To check the status of a specific payment, you are required to use the Payment Status Inquiry API which provides the current state of the payment. The proxy identifier is the MMID for a beneficiary.

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

503.description: System dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

post.description:
The Mobile Wallet Payment API exposes the ability to initiate domestic fund transfer from the Bank to a Mobile Wallet Account. Mobile Number is used to initiate the payment.
Upon a successful transaction a payment reference identifier is generated. The response is a representation or acknowledgment that an instruction was received successfully.
To check the status of a specific payment, you are required to use the Payment Status Inquiry API which provides the current state of the payment.

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

503.description: System dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

post.description:
The Payment Initiation API exposes the ability to initiate a payment instruction, upon success it returns a payment reference identifier.

The response is a representation or acknowledgment that an instruction was received successfully. To check the status of a specific payment, you are required to use the Payment Status Inquiry API which provides the current state of the payment.

Note: In this generic endpoint, the field instruction.creditor.identity should only be used when initiating a Proxy payment.

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

503.description: System dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

post.description: The Payment Initiation with Payee ID API provides you the ability to initiate a payment based on a given Payee ID. As a response upon success it returns a payment reference identifier. The response is a representation or acknowledgment that an instruction was received successfully.

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

503.description: System dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

get.description:
The Payment Retrieval API exposes the ability to query a given payment instruction, based on your payment reference identifier .

The response is a complete reproduction of the initiation message with the addition of internal identifiers used for internal reporting and tracking.

A successful response indicates that the payment was found, a 404 response indicates that the payment reference identifier was not received by the Bank.

parameters.name: referenceId
parameters.description: Reference ID to retrieve payment details

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

503.description: System dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

post.description: The Bulk Transfer initiation API exposes the ability to initiate single or multiple instructions in 1 message with message size less than 1 MB (approximate 400 instructions). This API supports both cross border and domestic transactions with the same debiting country in a single bulk request. Upon successful submission it returns a payment reference identifier for each instruction. The response is a representation or acknowledgment that an instruction was received successfully. To check the status of a specific payment, you are required to use the Payment Status Inquiry API which provides the current state of the payment.

rejected.errorMessage: Creditor Account Id exceeds maximum length (34 characters)

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

post.description:
The Payment Status Inquiry API provides the ability to retrieve the payment status for a given set of payment reference IDs. The payment status returned will be the status at the point in time indicated by the timestamp within the message.

To determine if a payment has completed processing, you can either poll the API at reasonable frequencies until the payment has reached its final status or you can use the webhook capability to receive push notifications.

For optimal performance, it is recommended that you are aware of the payment's final status for your use cases and stop pulling the API once the payment has reached its final status, and make small sets of calls concurrently instead of making a call for a large set of payment reference IDs at one go.

Note: Some booking locations, such as India, are subject to local data regulations. Ensure that you retrieve the status for payments of these particular booking locations individually, i.e., do not combine them with payments where the booking locations are not subject to such regulations. For more information, refer to the API Implementation Guide on how to use the "Routing-Identifier" header parameter.

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

503.description: System dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

post.description:
The PayNow Initiation API exposes the ability to initiate a payment instruction, upon success it returns a payment reference identifier.

The response is a representation or acknowledgment that an instruction was received successfully. To check the status of a specific payment, you are required to use the Paynow Status Inquiry API which provides the current state of the payment.

Unlike Payment Initiation API, the PayNow API mandates the population of the proxy identifier. The proxy identifier is the Singapore handle for a beneficiary.

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

503.description: System dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

post.summary: Singapore - PayNow Proxy with Name Validation
post.description: The PayNow Proxy with Name Validation API allows to initiate a Payment Instruction across Instant payments to a Proxy ID or Address after a successful validation of the Payee Name against the Actual Name of the Payee with the creditor bank. To check the status of a specific payment, you are required to use the Payment Status Inquiry API which provides the current state of the payment.

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

503.description: System dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

post.description:
The PayNow Status Inquiry API provides the ability to retrieve the payment status for a given set of payment reference IDs. The payment status returned will be the status at the point in time indicated by the timestamp within the message.

To determine if a payment has completed processing, you can either poll the API at reasonable frequencies until the payment has reached its final status or you can use the webhook capability to receive push notifications.

For optimal performance, it is recommended that you are aware of the payment's final status for your use cases and stop pulling the API once the payment has reached its final status, and make small sets of calls concurrently instead of making a call for a large set of payment reference IDs at one go.

Note: This API only supports the status inquiry of Singapore PayNow proxy payments.

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

503.description: System dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

paymentIdentifier.description: The internal payment reference assigned by the Bank

internalTrackingId.description: The unique end-to-end transaction reference (UETR) assigned by the Bank for tracking the payment.

clientReferenceId.description: Your company reference (endToEndId) shall be mapped here.

referenceId.description: Your company reference generated in reference field of payment initiation to be mapped here

statusString.description: Status assigned by the Bank. At HTTPS response, this status will always be Pending or Rejected.

timestamp.description: Timestamp when the transaction is received by the Bank

currencyCode.description: Debit account currency to be populated (ISO currency code). If the currency code differs from the debtor account currency, the FXConversion object is mandatory.

amount.description: Mandatory field describing the payment amount in payment currency units

priority.description: Applicable for cross border payments in certain countries. Priority can be given to either Debit date or Payment (Credit) value date. This will be taken into account during date calculation. Possible Values D - Debit, C - Credit. Default is C. This flag indicates that value of requiredExecutionDate to be treated as Debit Date or Credit Date

clearingSystemId.description:
Clearing System Identifier.
Either instruction.creditorAgent.financialInstitution.BIC or instruction.creditorAgent.clearingSystemId is required per market nuances. Mandatory for IBFT in Hong Kong, Nepal, Thailand, Vietnam Account Transfer and NAPAS Pay to Card, and Mobile Wallet Payment.

code.description:
Code
Please refer to the supported Instruction Codes in Swift MT103 Fields Specifications.

details.description:
Additional information
Please refer to the additional information inputs in Swift MT103 Fields Specifications.

OpenApiCreditorAgentInstructions.description: Please only use when needs to populate Field 23E Instruction Code and Field 72 Sender to Receiver Information in MT103 (applicable for GB and US market only).

city.description:
City
Please refer to SCB PAYMENTS_Supplementary document for the list of City Code and input for Mobile Wallet Payment initiation.

name.description: Financial Institution Name. Default to Standard Chartered Bank

BIC.description:
Financial Institution, SWIFT Business Identifier Code
Please refer to SCB PAYMENTS_Supplementary document for the list of Debit Bank BIC.

count.description: Required only for payments which require supporting documents

name.description: Financial Institution Name. Default to Standard Chartered Bank

BIC.description:
SWIFT Business Identifier Code.
Either instruction.creditorAgent.financialInstitution.BIC or instruction.creditorAgent.clearingSystemId is required per market nuances.

type.description: Financial Institution type. Mandatory for creditorAgent(paymentType = TT) if creditorAgent.clearingSystemId is not specified. Possible values are SW - SWIFT (default), CH  - CHIPS Universal Identifier, AC - Account, CP - CHIPS Participant Identifier, FW - Fedwire Routing Number, SC - UK Domestic Sort Code, TX - Free Text.

fxType.description: Applicable only if payment and debit account currencies are different. Indicates which FX rate needs to applied. For Deal @ Best, other fxconversion fields are not applicable. C - Contract Rate, D - Deal @ Best, H - Held rate (RFQ - prebooked deal)

contractId.description: FX Contract number for FX Deal. Applicable when fx type is C or H.

contractFXRate.description: FX Rate of FX Contract. Applicable when fx type is C or H.

contractFXAmount.description: FX Amount of FX Contract. Applicable when fx type is C or H.

deliveryOption.description: Applicable only for MCP (Cross Border) payment types such as XTT, XRTS, XACH, XBT, XPAY which indicates the delivery option of the fx rate. Delivery Options can be 'N' (Not Applicable), 'S' (Spot) , 'T' (Next Day), or 'D' (Same Day). If Debit and Payment currencies are the same, then only 'N' (Not Applicable) is allowed. Options 'S','T','D' are based on Debit and Payment currency pair.

OpenApiIdentity.description: This should only be used when initiating a Proxy payment.

id.description:
Identification Number. Validations for id
Value Validation
FIEMAIL minLength 6, maxLength 117
FIMSISDN maxLength 30
BILLERID maxLength 20
Other maxLength 18

identityType.description:
Possible values for Identification Type.
Country Proxy Type
HK EMAL - Pay to Email, MOBN - Pay to Mobile Number, SVID - Pay to FPS ID, HKID - Pay to HK ID
SG RetNRIC - Pay to NRIC, RetVPA - Pay to Virtual payment address, RetUEN - Business Registration No, RetMSISDN - Pay to Mobile Number
TH RetMSISDN - Pay to Mobile Number, RetNRIC - Pay to NRIC
PH FIMSISDN - Pay to Mobile Number, FIEMAIL - Pay to Email, BILLERID - Pay to Biller ID
MY RetUEN - Pay Business Registration No, RetMSISDN - Pay to Mobile Number, RetNRIC - Pay to NRIC, RetPSPT - Pay to Passport Number, RetPOAN - Pay to Police or Army No

code.description: Code represents statutory/regulatory information required by authorities in the country of the receiver or sender

details.description: Instruction Details of the statutory/regulatory information required by authorities in the country of the receiver or sender

description.description: Invoice Description. Supports Thai for TH specific payments

id.description:
On Behalf Of Account Number
The original ordering party's account number is mandatory for initiating OBO payment

line_1.description:
On Behalf Of Address Line 1
The original ordering party's address is mandatory for initiating OBO payment

city.description: On Behalf Of Address City Code

postcode.description: On Behalf Of Address Postal Code

country.description:
On Behalf Of Address Country Code
The original ordering party's country code is mandatory for initiating OBO payment

name.description:
On Behalf Of Name
The original ordering party's name is mandatory for initiating OBO payment

oboType.description:
On Behalf Of Address Type
The original ordering party's address type is mandatory for initiating OBO payment
K - Unstructured Address

OpenApiOnBehalfOfInfo.description: This should only be used when initiating an on-behalf-of (OBO) payment.

name.description:
Full Name
Creditor Name is mandatory for
Country API Category / API Name
All Account Transfer
HK, SG, PH Proxy with Name Validation
IN IMPS Initiation
TH PromptPay Initiation
ID BI-FAST Initiation

jointBeneficiaryIdentityType.description: Identity type of the secondary beneficiary

identifierType.description: Account Identifier Type, defaulted as BBAN

accountType.description: Account Type. Please consult with SCB team before selecting this value

city.description: If not provided, default city will be used

messageSender.description: This should be a constant tag to identify the senders system, it is used for audit and diagnostics. Defaulted as your corporate registered name

messageId.description: Unique Identifier for the transaction. This should be a unique tracking value (GUID) to identify the request, it is used for audit & support

countryCode.description: ISO Country Code - Used to identify the country of request origination

timestamp.description: Timestamp of creating the payment instruction. Must be a valid ISO format timestamp of this message, i.e. time message was generated in the form YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:mm:SS.SSSZ (UTC), e.g. 2019-01-01T13:30:32.010Z OR The value must be a Numeric Date[10 digits] and represented in seconds

batchId.description: Unique Identifier for the batch of bulk transactions. Required only for batch transactions

batchCount.description: Number of transactions. Required only for batch transactions

paymentTimestamp.description: Timestamp of creating the payment instruction. Must be a valid ISO format timestamp of the payment, i.e. time payment was requested in the form YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:mm:SS.SSSZ (UTC), e.g. 2019-01-01T13:30:32.010Z or the value must be a Numeric Date[10 digits] and represented in seconds.

paymentTypePreference.description: Indicates whether to use the fastest or cheapest or explicit payment type, this is currently based on predefined payment templates. Use fastest only for IBFT transfers, use explicit for all types of transactions. Recommendation is to default to explicit.

requiredExecutionDate.description: Required Execution Date of the payment

referenceId.description: Your Unique Reference ID for the payment. For ACH, BT & RTGS maxLength is 16. For IBFT - 35

thirdPartyId.description: Unique Client third party ID for the payment

thirdPartyIdApprover.description: Unique Client third party Approver for the payment

purpose.description:
Purpose code that is required by the country's clearing house
Country/Service MaxLength Possible Values
ID BIFAST 2 01-Investment, 02-Transfer of Wealth, 03-Purchase,99=Others

Defaults to CASH if not specified

paymentType.description: Payment type of the transaction, e.g. IBFT, BT, ACH, RTGS, TT, XBT, XACH

chargerBearer.description: Charge Indicator - DEBT, CRED, SHAR, SLEV, will default from payment template if defined.

serviceType.description: Mandatory for Thailand ACH and PAY. Optional for Thailand IBFT. Supported values - 01 - Salary Wage Pension; 02 - Dividend; 03 - Interest; 04 - Goods Services; 05 - Buying Securities; 06 - Tax Refund

subPaymentType.description: Pay Sub Product Type, e.g. CDWL, CDVY

datePriority.description: Applicable for cross border payments in certain countries. Priority can be given to either Debit date or Payment (Credit) value date. This will be taken into account during date calculation. Possible Values D - Debit, C - Credit. Default is C. This flag indicates that value of requiredExecutionDate to be treated as Debit Date or Credit Date

receivingCountryPurpose.description: Purpose of Payment that is required by the beneficiary country clearing house to be provided here

casIndicator.description: Indicates as CAS payment. Possible Value, Y - CAS Payment

paymentSubProductType.description:
Sub Payment Type for IBFT payment.
Please refer to SCB PAYMENTS_Supplementary document for the required Sub Payment Type.

chargeAccount.description: Indicates Account Number from which the charges to be deducted

discountType.description: Represents certain percentage (%) which will be applied on Invoice amount to compute the value for Discount Amount

vatType.description: Represents certain percentage (%) which will be applied on Invoice amount to compute the value for VAT Amount

vatAmount.description: Indicates VAT for mentioned Invoice amount

whtPrintingLocation.description: Indicates whether WHT form needs to be printed at Bank

whtRefNo.description: Running sequence number to identify WHT

discountAmount.description: Discount Amount which will be reduced from Invoice amount to compute payment amount

bopCode1.description:
BOP Transaction Code1
Required for cross border payments regulatory reporting for China

bopCode2.description:
BOP Transaction Code2
Required for cross border payments regulatory reporting for China

natureOfPayment.description:
Nature of Payment
Required for cross border payments regulatory reporting for China

residentCountry.description:

Required for cross border payments regulatory reporting for China

Regulatory Reporting Transaction Remarks 1
Required for cross border payments regulatory reporting for China

Required for cross border payments regulatory reporting for China

Required for cross border payments regulatory reporting for China

amount1.description:

amount2.description:

unstructured.description: Payment details can be shared in this field

multiUnstructured.description:
Unstructured Remittance Information
Please input max 2 lines of remittance information for your payment.
Element Length Validation Allowed characters
Payment detail line 1 minLength = 0, maxLength = 70 a-z A-Z 0-9 /?().,'+:-
Payment detail line 2 minLength = 0, maxLength = 70 a-z A-Z 0-9 /?().,'+:-

items.description: multiUnstructured is an optional field available to clients to enter two(2) lines of details for a transaction. <table> <tr> <th>Element</th> <th>Length Validation</th> <th>Allowed characters</th> </tr> <tr> <th>Payment detail line 1</th> <th>minLength = 0, maxLength = 70</th> <th>a-z A-Z 0-9 /?().,'+:-</th> </tr> <tr> <th>Payment detail line 2</th> <th>minLength = 0, maxLength = 70</th> <th>a-z A-Z 0-9 /?().,'+:-</th> </tr>

creditorReferenceId.description:
Code used in Remittance Information
Please refer to the supported codes in Swift MT103 Fields Specifications.

creditorReferenceDetails.description:
Details used in Remittance Information
Please refer to Swift MT103 Fields Specifications for more details.

OpenApiStructureRemittanceInfo.description: Please only use when needs to populate Field 70 Remittance Information in MT103 (applicable for TT payment type in GB and US only).

description.description: Description of WHT type. Supports Thai for TH specific payments.

grossAmount.description: WHT Gross Amount. The entered amount will be printed on the WHT Certificate and might be different from the payment amount

paymentTimestamp.description: Timestamp of creating the payment instruction. Must be a valid ISO format timestamp of the payment, i.e. time payment was requested in the form YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:mm:SS.SSSZ (UTC), e.g. 2019-01-01T13:30:32.010Z or the value must be a Numeric Date[10 digits] and represented in seconds.

requiredExecutionDate.description: Required Execution Date of the payment

referenceId.description: Your Unique Reference ID for the payment. For ACH, BT & RTGS maxLength is 16. For IBFT - 35

purpose.description: Purpose of the payment, defaults to CASH if not specified

paymentType.description: Payment type of the transaction, e.g. IBFT, BT, ACH, RTGS, TT, XBT, XACH

chargerBearer.description: Charge Indicator - DEBT, CRED, SHAR, SLEV, will default from payment template if defined.

OpenApiBulkPaymentId.description: Rejected list of bulk payment reference IDs

accepted.description: Accepted list of bulk payment reference IDs

items.description: Accepted list of bulk payment reference IDs

rejected.description: Rejected list of bulk payment reference IDs

OpenApiBulkPaymentIds.description: List of Bulk Payment Status Details

groupId.description: Your registered group ID with the Bank.

endToEndId.description: Your reference ID/end-to-end ID of the payment initiation request.

clientIdentifier.description: Your reference ID provided in the payment initiation request.

paymentContainerId.description: An internal reference ID assigned by the API banking channel.

statusString.description:
The description of the status code.
Possible values: Pending, Processed, Completed, Rejected, Returned, Stopped

statusCode.description: The payment status code assigned by the Bank.

lastAssignee.description:
The last assigned interface application of the payment.
Possible values: API, CCSAgent, SCPay

reasonCode.description: The reason code assigned by the Bank.

reasonIsoCode.description: (Not in use) The reason ISO code in case of rejection.

additionalInformation.description: The additional information of the payment updated by the product processing system if available.

timestamp.description: The UTC timestamp of the status record creation time.

originalTransactionId.description: Your reference ID provided in the payment initiation request.

clearingSystemReference.description: The clearing reference number assigned by the product processing system if available.

limitBreachIndicator.description: (Not in use) The limit breach indicator.

reasonInformation.description: The payment status information assigned by the Bank.

instructionIdentifier.description: The unique end-to-end transaction reference (UETR) which is automatically assigned by the Bank during payment initiation.

referenceId.description: Your reference ID provided in the payment initiation request.

paymentType.description: The payment type of the transaction.

requiredExecutionDate.description: The execution date of the payment.

debtorAccountCurrency.description: The ISO 3-character currency code of the debtor account currency.

customerFxRate.description: (Not in use) The customer FX Rate.

valueDate.description: The value date (processing date) of the payment.

debitDate.description: The debit date of the payment.

OpenApiPaymentStatus.description: The payment status details per transaction based on clientReferenceId.

statuses.description: The payment status details for single and multiple transaction(s).

OpenApiPostalAddress.description: (Not in use) The creditors address information.
